text: Bottle 750ml.Clear light to medium yellow colour with a small, fizzy, virtually none lacing, fully diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy pear, sweet pear, light celery and barnyard, cheese notes. Flavour is moderate sweet and light light acidic with a average to long duration, dry. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat. [20111105]

Bottle, 75cl. Its an almost colorless perry, some yellowish tints though. Clear. The aroma is on the fruity side, pears and apples, and some farmyard hints. Some sulphur notes in both aroma and flavor. Else theres pears dominating the flavor, something I dont recognize blends in. Its quite sweetish too, medium to full bodied and quite oily. A decent perry, but not very interesting. 111105

Bottle @ Early Winter Tasting, Ulfborg, 2011. Pours cloudy clear yellow with bubbles on top. Dry..Pear and apple. Barnyard and svovl. Refreshing and easy.
Clear pale yellow. Aroma is sweet and pears. Flavor is medium sweet. Dry finish. 051111
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. No head. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are sweet perries, sugar and notes of alcohol. Nice, dry and a little citric.
Botttle @ FOneFan. Clear pale yellow with no head. Aroma is pear and fruit. Flavour is pear, little apples, sweet, little acid and fruit.
From bag in a box at Green Berry Walmer.  pale geen.  Probably slightly on the turn.  Some vinegar but still decent fruit.  Sugar is there too.  cant say I enjoyed it but it had some good points

Bottle from Tanners Wines, Hereford.  Slightly hazy, pale gold with a small amount of short-lived carbonation. Big, sweet pear juice aroma with some yeast character and touch of wood. Flavour was also dominated by attractive sweet pears, with some accompanying spice, and a touch of sugar in the finish. An excellent sweet perry.

A Mes rate. Cask at the Southampton Arms.Wow wow wow. This is excellent stuff. Amazing hazy lemon yellow colour. Massive freshly pressed pears on the nose. Incredibly juicy yet dry in the mouth. Just the right level of fruit and wood. Effortlessly drinkable. Hints of vanilla and cinnamon are just about perfect. Absolutely outstanding stuff.

Beautiful clear deep pale straw golden body; Incredible nose with lots of both depth and fill, a near perfect constellation of dense almost petrol like perry aromas, mellow yeasts and the dense but light harshness from the peel; Incredible body, velvet soft oily texture some sweetness the its not the least vulgar but has lots of freshness to it is super balanced with a very dry yeast peel like harshness; The dry part continues with great length in the finish, again with the sweetness near perfectly on the side, perry meat and lots of peel aromas, even a very light barrel touch that gives an almost smoked touch very late in the finish. Thanks Fin - The Cider (Perry) provider!!!

Bottle from Oakchurch Farm Shop, Staunton on Wye, Herefordshire, consumed 11-10-09   Pours a very, very light silvery gold colour, its as clear as a bell. Soft sweet juicy pears on the aroma. The taste is of soft sweet pear, touch overipe, little bit of dustiness from somewhere (glass was clean?), really just loads of lovely squishy overipe pear, bit sweet possibly and a totally differnet perry to the recently tried Thorn but nonetheless, its very, very good.    A6 A5 F8 P4 Ov14  3.7
Pale hazy lemonade colour. Sour and slightly funky pear aroma. Tart with a real acid attack.

Comments: Tannic and rather phenolic perry with strong plasticy flavour.
